description: This course examines issues of race and ethnicity in Latin America from colonial times to the
present.  Although not directly comparative, by highlighting the region's distinctive tradition of
racial mixture the course provides students with a model of race relations that contrasts sharply
with that of the U.S.  The course also concerns changing ideas about race in Latin America and
the impact of these ideas on debates over national identity.  Offered periodically.
fullname: HIstorical Perspectives on Race and Ethnicity in Latin America
